heading: PanX
description:
A chrome extension boilerplate to inject an iframe panel to a webpage.
This sort of creates a sandboxed environment for all your extension stuff to be present directly on the page and get rid of the annoying "popup" provided OOB that goes away as soon as you start interacting with the page content.

It also has examples as to how to communicate between the host page and your extension to create more coherent experience for your users.

Tools and technologies used:-
  • Chrome Extension
  • Service workers
  • Vanilla JS
  • HTML
  • CSS

heading: High-light
description:
A cross-browser library of CSS to highlight your content.
It's a pure CSS library written in SCSS and compiled to be distributed as minified CSS.

You can simply include this compiled CSS, as you would normally use any other CSS file, in your project and highlight any piece of content on the go!

Currently supported highlights:-
  • black-widow

  • light-knight
Tools and technologies used:-
  • SASS
  • CSS
  • HTML
  • SCSS
  • Github workflows

heading: Navlet
description:
Add scroll to top button on any page.
This extension adds scroll to top and bottom button on any page.
You can get this extension from chrome store.

You can also use this as a bookmarklet to use only on the pages you want. Simply drag the "Navlet" button here on your bookmarks bar and just click it on any page where you would want help to scroll at top and bottom with ease :)

Tools and technologies used:-
  • Bookmarklet
  • Chrome Extension
  • Service workers
  • Vanilla JS
  • HTML
  • CSS
